intro: Axinaea quitensis, commonly known as the Andean wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Axinaea quitensis is often found in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
